title: 4 Quick Ways to Forget Saved Account Info on Instagram

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This looks like a camera icon with a multicolored background. If you're logged into your account, you'll see your feed. If you're not logged into an account and you see the login screen, tap the cog icon in the top-right corner. Select the account to remove, and then tap Remove account .

steps.title: Switch to the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Switch to the account you want to remove. If you're signed in with multiple Instagram accounts and want to stop remembering one of them, double-tap your profile icon at the bottom-right until the profile you want to remove is active. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's the three horizontal lines at the top-right corner of your profile. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Log out.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Log out . This is at the very bottom in red. A pop-up window will open with all your current accounts.

steps.title: Toggle off the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Toggle off the account you want to remove. When you log out, Instagram has the option to save your login information to iCloud for the next time you log in. When this option is toggled off, your information won't be saved.

steps.title: Tap Log out.
steps.content: Tap Log out . You'll be signed out of your account and the information will be removed. You can also delete the account's saved login info from Keychain (iPhone/iPad) or Chrome (Android).

steps.title: Go to https://www.instagram.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ . You can use any browser. If you're already logged into an account, click your profile icon in the top-right corner and select Log Out .

steps.title: Click Remove Account.
steps.content: Click Remove Account . This will be underneath your saved login. If you don't see Continue as [username] , your information has not been saved on the Instagram website.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . This will remove your remembered account and return you to the login screen.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings . It's the gray gear icon on your Home screen or in your App Library. [3] X Research source If you have already removed the account from Instagram but still see the username and password as a suggestion, removing it from Keychain will solve the problem. Removing the Instagram account from Keychain will also ensure that the password is no longer suggested in Safari when you're using your Mac.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Passwords.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Passwords . This is next to a key icon. You may need to verify with Face ID, Touch ID, or a passcode.

steps.title: Type Instagram into the search field.
steps.content: Type Instagram into the search field. Now you'll see all Instagram accounts saved to your Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the account you want to remove. This displays the username and other details for this account.

steps.title: Tap Delete Password.
steps.content: Tap Delete Password . A confirmation message will appear. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Delete to confirm. Now that the password is removed from Keychain, it will no longer show up as a login option in the Instagram app or in Safari on your Mac.

steps.title: Open the Chrome app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Chrome app on your Android. The account you removed from Instagram might still have its username and password saved to your Android. You can remove saved passwords you no longer need from Chrome. [5] X Research source Removing the saved login from Chrome also ensures that you won't see this Instagram account in your saved passwords in Chrome on your computer.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This displays your Chrome settings.

steps.title: Tap Password Manager.
steps.content: Tap Password Manager . It's near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap the password you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the password you want to remove. This will be listed underneath Instagram .

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . The password will be deleted from Chrome.
